title: Sanjun Gu Grafting Farmers Forum Presentation 2012

tasks.task: Attend a farmers forum presentation on tomato grafting.
subtasks: Arrive at the forum and introduce yourself.
Acknowledge the presenter, Dr. Sanjun Gu.
Learn about the benefits of tomato grafting, such as disease resistance and enhanced vigor.
Understand the grafting process for tomatoes, including rootstock and scion selection.
Follow grafting procedures, such as cutting and tubing methods to create graft unions.
Monitor graft survival rates in various conditions (greenhouse and field).
Observe stem diameter growth as an indicator of grafting success.
Consider the impact of high tunnel environments (single vs. double layer poly) on grafted tomato plants.
Analyze yield differences between grafted and non-grafted tomatoes.
Address questions about grafting other cucurbit vegetables (e.g., watermelons, cucumbers).
Distinguish between heirloom and hybrid tomatoes in grafting compatibility.
Recognize the importance of soil-borne disease resistance and cold tolerance in grafted vegetables.
